io.reactivex.remote

Class RemoteEventController<T>

  • java.lang.Object
    • io.reactivex.remote.RemoteEventController<T>
  • Type Parameters:
    T - Supported types are String, Byte, Short, Integer, Long, Float, Double, Boolean, Parcelable, or any class annotated with @Parcel

    public class RemoteEventController<T>
extends java.lang.Object
    Use this class to send the data at the server side that needs to be delivered to the rx.Observable at the client side.

    To send a event, use sendEvent(Object)

    Use sendCompleted() to inform the client rx.Observable that the data stream is complete

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      RemoteEventController()
      Create a default instance of RemoteEventController Use sendEvent(Object), sendCompleted() to send the data
      RemoteEventController(<any> observable)
      Creates an instance of RemoteEventController with the given Observable

      Override this to know when first client subscribed to the observable

      Override this to know when ALL clients have unsubscribed.

      • onClosed

        public void onClosed()
        Override this to know when the client closed the remote observable. Perform any cleanup here

      • setDebug

        public void setDebug(boolean enable)
        Enable or disable debug prints. Disabled by default

      • setIgnoreIfDuplicateOfLast

        public void setIgnoreIfDuplicateOfLast(boolean ignoreIfDuplicateOfLast)
        If set, the sendEvent(Object) wont be delivered if it is same as last event. Default false
